items.name: Asma B.
items.text: Thanks to CARI, I found my dream job in 6 months! The personalized support and workshops gave me the confidence I needed to succeed in my interviews.

items.name: Jean-Pierre H.
items.text: From refugee to entrepreneur, CARI supported me at every step. Today, I have my own business and employ 5 people.

items.name: Jasmine M.
items.text: French seemed impossible, now I speak it fluently! The courses are excellent and the teachers very patient.

items.name: Karla A.
items.text: My children are thriving, we found our place here. CARI's family services made all the difference.

items.name: Wei L.
items.text: The help understanding the Quebec system changed everything. I now feel at home in Montreal.

welcome.title: Welcome & Integration
welcome.description: Information, orientation and personalized support to facilitate your settlement.
welcome.fullDescription: Individualized support and group activities to promote your settlement and facilitate your integration into your new community. We help you become independent and thrive in Quebec.
welcome.details: Free service offered in French, English, Spanish, Arabic and other languages. In-person or phone appointments.

french.title: French Learning
french.description: French courses adapted for immigrants, all levels, flexible schedules (8:30 AM-10 PM). Test your level for free!
french.fullDescription: Full-time and part-time French training, adapted to the learner's level. Our qualified and attentive teachers use modern teaching methods.
benefits: Flexible schedules from 8:30 AM to 10 PM
french.details: Free courses funded by MIFI. Possibility of participation allowance. Continuous enrollment.

employment.title: Employment Assistance
employment.description: Resume workshops, interview simulations, professional coaching and meetings with employers.
employment.fullDescription: Dynamic job search approaches, networking activities and connections with employers. Personalized support to facilitate your integration into the Quebec job market.
benefits: Resume and cover letter writing workshops
employment.details: Free service with personalized follow-up. Individual appointments and regular group workshops.

family.title: Family Services
family.description: Support for families, activities for children and teenagers, help with schooling.
family.fullDescription: Support for immigrant parents with childcare services, school orientation and activities promoting children's overall development and parental integration.
family.details: Free or low-cost services. Limited spots, registration required.

women.title: Women of the World
women.description: Specific programs for immigrant women: autonomy, health, employment.
women.fullDescription: A dedicated space to break women's isolation through intercultural connections, mutual support networks and professional skills development for immigrant women and residents.
women.details: Free and confidential. Welcoming and supportive group. Childcare available on request.

volunteering.title: Volunteering & Pairing
volunteering.description: Intercultural meetings, social activities and volunteering opportunities.
volunteering.fullDescription: Intercultural pairing program, skills development, language and computer courses, citizenship integration pathway and volunteering opportunities to foster community belonging.
volunteering.details: Free. Flexible commitment based on your availability. Volunteering certificates available.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.statement: Welcome, help and accompany immigrants in their personal, social and professional integration.
mission.vision: Serve and unite through innovative expertise and practices for a better life together.
mission.historyIntro: Created in 1989, the Centre d'Accueil et de Référence sociale et économique pour Immigrants de Saint-Laurent (CARI St-Laurent) is a non-profit, non-denominational and non-partisan organization.
mission.approach: An intercultural approach based on respect for difference, openness to others and ethnocultural and religious diversity.
mission.impact: Over 7,000 people supported each year, from 128 countries and speaking 95 different languages.
